verse.name: v1
verse.lines: Gray in the moonlight, and green in the sun, Dark in the evening, bright in the dawn, Ever the meadow goes endlessly on, And Anna at each turning.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: Sweet in the springtide, sour in fall, Winter casts snow, a white velvet caul. Passage in summer is swiftest of all And Anna at each turning.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: Look to the meadows and look to the hills, Look to the rocks where the swift river spills, Look to the farmland the farmer still tills For Anna is returning.
